summary: This document is an investigative summary from the FBI New York field office, in coordination with the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office, outlining the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and co-conspirators for sexual exploitation of minors. It details the charges and arrests of Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and provides updates on the superseding indictment and trial schedule for Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation for sexual exploitation and abuse of minors. He was charged and arrested with sex trafficking and conspiracy in July 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Investigated as a co-conspirator who assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse of minors by recruiting, grooming, and abusing them. She was charged and arrested in July 2020 and faced a superseding indictment in March 2021.

connections.description: Maxwell assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse of minors by recruiting, grooming, and abusing them.

events.title: Epstein's arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged and arrested with sex trafficking and conspiracy.

events.title: Maxwell's arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged and arrested with enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.

events.title: Superseding indictment against Maxwell
events.description: A federal grand jury returned a superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, adding two new charges (Sex Trafficking of a Minor and Sex Trafficking Conspiracy) and expanding the timeframe for existing conspiracy charges.

events.title: Maxwell trial jury selection begins
events.description: Jury selection for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial is scheduled to begin.

events.title: Maxwell trial begins
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is set to begin.

keyFacts: The investigation involves the sexual exploitation and abuse of minors committed by Jeffrey Epstein, with Ghislaine Maxwell identified as a key co-conspirator.

The superseding indictment against Maxwell (March 29, 2021) added charges for Sex Trafficking of a Minor and Sex Trafficking Conspiracy from 2001-2004, and expanded the timeframe for earlier conspiracy charges to cover 1994-2004.
Maxwell's trial was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, with jury selection starting November 15, 2021.
The document confirms coordination between the FBI New York field office and the Southern District of New York's U.S. Attorney's Office in this investigation.
